page.title: 11LOWER HARDRES AREA-FARMS 2
page.content: {Winters Farmhouse}was built in 1660. In the farmyard are concrete plum silos built in the 1939-45 war. Unfortunately no provision was made for removing the plums at the bottom so the structure proved useless. A barn at Winters Farm is thatched with heather and one at nearby{Merton Farm with hop bindings. On Stone Street a Roman road is{Iffin Farm}with 86 acres of fruit trees. The farmhouse dates from 1750. The barns are roofed with straw thatching and Kent Peg Tiles. The new long straw thatching is expected to last about 25 years.{Upper {Horton Farm}has 330 acres mainly arable. The farmhouse built in 1955 appears older but the 2 pairs of semi- detached farm houses built the same year are typical of the period. The Nissen Huts, built in the 2nd World War, have been used as pig sties.
